sentence: Robust existing home sales numbers, an improving labor market and positive consumer sentiment are enough to drive momentum in the retail space.
On Friday, the National Association of Realtors said that existing home sales jumped 14.7% in the month of December.
It therefore makes sense to pick up a few retail stocks that have solid fundamentals.
Here we have highlighted one such stock, a home improvement retailer - Lowe's Companies, Inc.LOW - that looks promising with a long-term earnings growth rate of 16.2%.
We believe an improving job scenario, gradual recovery in the housing market and merchandising initiatives bode well for Lowe's in the long run.
In addition, the Canadian business is performing quite well with strong comps growth (in local currency) witnessed over the last several quarters.
Moreover, the company has acquired 12 former Target locations across Canada and has plans to open 2 more stores in the region that will help it to penetrate further into the Canadian market.
Lowe's maintains a shareholder friendly policy.
In the third quarter of fiscal 2015, the company repurchased $750 million worth of shares and also paid $250 million in dividend.
In May 2015, the company hiked its dividend by 21.7% to 28 cents per share.
Moreover, last year, the company had announced a $5 billion worth of additional authorization, thereby bringing the total share repurchase authorization to $6.4 billion.
Further, in September, the company entered into a $500 million accelerated share repurchase agreement.

Lowe's which shares space with The Home Depot, Inc. HD , Beacon Roofing Supply, Inc. BECN and Builders FirstSource, Inc. BLDR has delivered positive earnings surprises in four out of the trailing six quarters.
Lowe's posted strong results for the third quarter of fiscal 2015 wherein both the top and bottom line surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate.
The company's earnings per share of 80 cents surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 78 cents and increased 35.6% from 59 cents reported in the prior-year quarter.
During third-quarter fiscal 2015, comps were positive across all 14 regions and 12 out of 13 product categories.
From the above discussion it is quite apparent that Lowe's holds the potential to merit a place in your portfolio.
